subject: Home & DIY
title: Only 9% of Plastic Is Actually Recycled
description: A short lesson to help you apply Only 9% of Plastic Is Actually Recycled.

hook.text: Of all plastic ever made, only 9% was recycled. 12% was burned. The other 79% sits in landfills or nature.

buildup.text: Recycling symbols 1-7 suggest recyclability, but most facilities only process #1 (PET) and #2 (HDPE) well.

discovery.text: Plastic degrades each cycle‚Äîfibers shorten, quality drops. A bottle becomes fabric, then filler, then trash.

twist.text: China's 2018 National Sword policy banned waste imports. Countries that shipped trash abroad had nowhere to send it.

climax.text: Reducing and reusing beat recycling every time. One reusable bottle displaces 156 disposable ones per year.

punchline.text: Recycling is the last resort, not the solution.

quiz.question: What percentage of all plastic ever produced has been recycled?
